column4: When I did sudo /etc/init.d/kdm stop and then startx from the command line, Xorg caught sig11
still curious: What's the output of ls -ld ~ /tmp ?
I said already, it never got the /tmp mount point, stupid setup didn't know it WAS to mount at /tmp
So you're trying to start X without a /tmp ?
yes, just not a separate partition
So tell me what that command prints.
Everything looks fine. That's not the problem thenl sorry to bother you.
